issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
To reproduce add ti.cloud example in to a default Studio project and build this project for device.
h5. Actual result
{code}
[ERROR] unable to open database file
[INFO] loading xml module
[ERROR] line = 2
[ERROR] message = Module not found facebook.js
[ERROR] source = var Facebook = Ti.Facebook ? Ti.Facebook : require('facebook');
[ERROR] file = app/native/assets/windows/social/table.js
[ERROR] 

[ERROR] line = 1
[ERROR] source = ï¿½[ERROR] file = undefined
[ERROR] trace = SyntaxError: Unexpected token 
[ERROR]     at Object.parse (native)
[ERROR]     at [object Object].<anonymous> (ti.cloud.js:79:285)
{code}
fields.summary: BlackBerry : using ti.cloud module throws the Error requiring Ti.Facebook module
fields.environment:
Mac osx 10.9.4 Mavericks
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201407111535
Titanium SDK, build:  3.3.0.v20140711123603
Node.JS Version: v0.10.28 
NPM Version: 1.4.9 
acs@1.0.15 
alloy@1.4.0-rc4
npm@1.4.9 
titanium@3.3.0-rc4 
titanium-code-processor@1.1.1
Device: BB Z10 (10.2.1)

comments.body: Placing these items on hold for the moment based on community interest.
Closing ticket as BlackBerry is no longer supported by us.
